intro: Linanthus killipii, commonly known as Killip's linanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in California and Nevada. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
